messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: For those of you who I am yet to meet, I want to introduce myself. I'm David Johnston, and I am standing to be your MP on 12th December. I went to a poor performing comprehensive school and was the first person in my family to go to university. I have spent the last 16 years running organisations that improve education and employment opportunities for people across the country. I now want to ensure that everyone in this constituency has the chance to raise their education and employment opportunities, and that children, whatever their background, are helped to get a better start to their adult life, a good job or to grow their local business - all of which needs us to have better infrastructure. From Faringdon to Wallingford and everywhere in between I am here to be a strong voice for you in Parliament. I look forward to catching up with you soon so we can discuss the concerns you might have and how I can help you. Help me make our constituency a better place to live, work and bring up children. Yours sincerely, David Johnston Your Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for Wantage.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improvements are needed to the A34 to make this safer for both local and national traffic. The A4130 needs to become a dual carriageway from the Science Bridge into the Milton Park area needs to be built, so our area can grow economically.
Our officers do a fantastic job, but more officers are needed to keep our streets safe. Thames Valley Police will gain 183 new frontline officers as part of the Prime Minister's plan.
David wants to bring his expertise to his constituency and work with employers to provide mentors and work experience opportunities so we can unlock the potential of local young people.
Wants to ensure that Britain continues to be a world leader in fighting climate change and meet our commitment for net zero emissions by 2050.

issues.environment: We’re all more conscious of our environment nowadays. It’s we who must take forward that consciousness and turn it into action. Leading the charge is our commitment to zero emissions by 2050 to ensure that the UK builds a sustainable future.
